heisig_chinese_memo: Dropping a hooked walking stick into the water causes a splash.
heisig_story: This character, which looks a bit like a snowflake, is actually a pictograph of water - not any particular body of water or movement of water, but simply the generic name for water. Should you have any difficulty remembering it, simply think of a walking stick being dropped vertically into the water, sending droplets out in all four directions. Then all you need to learn is how to write it in proper order.
koohiiStory1: The kanji for water is an abstract primitive itself, so unless one is willing to break down its etymological development, it should just simply be memorized by strokes; constructing a story is not necessarily useful unless it strongly denotes its shape (I find that Heisig¬¥s story doesn¬¥t do this).
koohiiStory2: For those having issues with this* "A 7K foot pool of water" Notice it looks like a 7, and a K. Might have to practice writing it a few times.

WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The water radical and the water kanji are the same.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: So as long as you know the radicals, you know the kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Imagine a lake (i.e. a whole bunch of water). When you think of water, you should try to think of this beautiful lake. It‚Äôs sunny, the trees smell nice (imagine a tree smell if you can ‚Äì the more senses you use the better!) and on that tree there is an awesome tire swing („Åô„ÅÑ). You get onto the tire swing and you are swinging back and forth. The water is right in front of you, and you are able to use the swing to throw yourself into the water. It‚Äôs a lot colder than you expected, and you come back to the surface, gasping for breath. The water gets into your mouth and you taste it. How strange, it‚Äôs very, very sweet. Imagine the sweetness of the water and how weird it is (really really sweet, this water is).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: I know that was a long one, but try to imagine all the different bits. Try to feel the feelings (cold, smell, etc) too. The more you create in this fake memory (which you‚Äôre using to remember and associate water with „Åô„ÅÑ (swing)) the more likely you are to end up remembering enough to make it happen. Especially when it comes to the senses part, the more vividly you imagined it, the more likely you are to remember the on‚Äôyomi.

humanum_full_description_en:
The word " water " oracle bone inscriptions vary in different provinces. The center stroke is used as a stream, and the dots beside it are used as water droplets. The number of water droplets varies. When the word "Ê∞¥" is used as a radical, the number of water flows varies, or there are paths in the shape of droplets. The " water " in the bronze inscription is also like flowing water, and the Warring States script inherits the inscription. The characters of Chu State may have the form of connecting the upper left and upper right strokes, and the strokes are slightly different from the past.

The Oracle " water " is used as the original meaning, referring to floods. Such as "Collection" 10150: "Qi „û¢ (have) big water". Or used as a sacrificial name, such as "Compilation" 14407: "Xin Yushui is in the dungeon." " Tu " is the abbreviation for "Xiangtu", the fourth ancestor of Shang Dynasty. Royal Festival and Water Festival. There are also " water " as the verb, such as "Collection" 23532: "Today Wang Qishui °®¶ (sleeping)." Jao Zongyi believes that "water sleeping" refers to the level of legislation, hanging ropes and empty ground. "Zhou Li" mentioned that "artisans build a country, water and land are counties", Zheng Xuan's note: "Set up at the four corners and hang water with water, hope that it will rise and fall, the altitude is established, it is the position and the level." Yiyun: "Water is accurate. Accurate and flat." Therefore, "water sleeping" may refer to the construction of palaces, and water is used to measure the level of land. The other theory is based on the interpretation of "water sleeping" as the temple of sawashing (Liu Xinglong, Cui Hengsheng).

Bronze writing is also used as the original meaning. Like Gui: "Lu (Jue) Ni (Suo) nephew (to) in Xuanshui." Refers to the north as in Xuanshui. The inscription of the word " water " can be faked as " begging ", which means to ask (Zhou Fagao, Fang Shuxin). For example, Shen Zigui: "Water (begging) with water (begging), Èúùjin (life)." It means begging for good destiny.

"Shuowen": "Water, quasi. Travel in the north. Like all waters flowing side by side, there is a slight sun in it. All water belongs to the water." According to Xu Shen's so-called "north trip", "there is micro "Yang Qi" is the doctrine of the Yin and Yang school that prevailed in the Han Dynasty. "Water, quasi-ye" is originally a sound training. Later, "level" becomes a compound word, which is first interpreted as a tool for measuring level, and then extended to refer to the degree of achievement in a certain aspect.
humanum_short_description_en: The shape of water flowing. The original meaning is water.

The word " water" oracle bone inscriptions vary in different provinces. The center stroke is used as a stream, and the dots beside it are used as water droplets. The number of water droplets varies. When the word " Ê∞¥" is used as a radical, the number of water flows varies, or there are paths in the shape of droplets. The " water" in the bronze inscription is also like flowing water, and the Warring States script inherits the inscription. The characters of Chu State may have the form of connecting the upper left and upper right strokes, and the strokes are slightly different from the past. The Oracle " water" is used as the original meaning, referring to floods. Such as "Collection" 10150: "Qi „û¢ (have) big water". Or used as a sacrificial name, such as "Compilation" 14407: "Xin Yushui is in the dungeon." " Tu" is the abbreviation for "Xiangtu", the fourth ancestor of Shang Dynasty. Royal Festival and Water Festival. There are also " water" as the verb, such as "Collection" 23532: "Today Wang Qishui °®¶ (sleeping)." Jao Zongyi believes that "water sleeping" refers to the level of legislation, hanging ropes and empty ground. "Zhou Li" mentioned that "artisans build a country, water and land are counties", Zheng Xuan's note: "Set up at the four corners and hang water with water, hope that it will rise and fall, the altitude is established, it is the position and the level." Yiyun: "Water is accurate. Accurate and flat." Therefore, "water sleeping" may refer to the construction of palaces, and water is used to measure the level of land. The other theory is based on the interpretation of "water sleeping" as the temple of sawashing (Liu Xinglong, Cui Hengsheng). Bronze writing is also used as the original meaning. Like Gui: "Lu (Jue) Ni (Suo) nephew (to) in Xuanshui." Refers to the north as in Xuanshui. The inscription of the word " water" can be faked as " begging", which means to ask (Zhou Fagao, Fang Shuxin). For example, Shen Zigui: "Water (begging) with water (begging), Èúùjin (life)." It means begging for good destiny. "Shuowen": "Water, quasi. Travel in the north. Like all waters flowing side by side, there is a slight sun in it. All water belongs to the water." According to Xu Shen's so-called "north trip", "there is micro "Yang Qi" is the doctrine of the Yin and Yang school that prevailed in the Han Dynasty. "Water, quasi-ye" is originally a sound training. Later, "level" becomes a compound word, which is first interpreted as a tool for measuring level, and then extended to refer to the degree of achievement in a certain aspect.

(1) Hydroxide compound formed by the combination of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom is a colorless, odorless, and tasteless liquid. Under certain conditions, it also exists in solid or gaseous state. Water is an indispensable part of living organisms.
(2) Specifically refers to rivers.
(3) Refers to all waters in general. For land.
(4) The general term for juice and liquid.
(5) Hidden words for urine. See "water and fire".
(6) Flood; flood.
(7) Refers to water attack. Flood the enemy with water.
(8) Swimming.
(9) In some ancient countries, a method of verifying the judgment of prison, the so-called "shenzhen".
(10) Soaking; moisturizing.
(11) It used to refer to the life situation in which women suffer pain and abuse.
(12) Extended to improper fields of activity.
(13) One of the five elements.
(14) Star name. See also "Mercury", "Shui Su".
(15) Official name.
(16) Chinese medicine is called kidney.
(17) The horizontal path between the two ends of the ancient chessboard.
(18) Refers to the level of things.
(19) It used to refer to the fineness of silver, which was converted to currency exchange premiums, remittance fees and additional income.
(20) Quantifiers. Refers to the number of times related to water.
(21) One of the ethnic minorities in our country. Detailed "Aquatic".
(22) Last name. Ming You Shui Jia
